newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Elf Nigeria says top two men have quit.
newsitem.headline: Elf Nigeria says top two men have quit.

text.p: Elf Petroleum Nigeria Limited said on Tuesday its managing director Yngvar Heide and chairman Frederic Isoard have resigned.

Heide, a Norwegian who took up his position in 1995, left for personal reasons and had been replaced by Francois Viaud, a Frenchman who until now was executive general manager, oil and gas at Elf Nigeria, the company said in a statement.
Isoard is replaced by Jean-Francois Gavalda, who also doubles as Elf's group vice-president for exploration and production in Africa.
Elf Nigeria is a joint venture between France's Elf Aquitaine and state-run Nigerian National Petroleum Corp.
It pumps 130,000 barrels per day of crude oil and is a major player in the Nigerian oil industry.
Heide's departure coincides with the recent re-posting of several other chief executives of multinational oil firms in Nigeria, including Mobil Corp, Chevron Corp and Royal Dutch/Shell Group.
